title: Amelia Bambridge missing: Police searching for body of Brit backpacker in Cambodia

Police investigating the disappearance of British backpacker Amelia Bambridge have quizzed six men and are looking for a body.

The 21-year-old was last seen at a beach party on the Cambodian island of Koh Rong on Thursday morning.

Her family members flew out to join a local search party while well wishers donated money for the rescue effort back at home in Worthing, West Sussex.

Now more than five days since she went missing, growing fears for her safety have been intensified by police who admitted the nature of the search had changed.

(Image: TIM STEWART NEWS LIMITED)

(Image: TIM STEWART NEWS LIMITED)

"We are looking for a body now," one police chief admitted, AFP reported.

The six men, some of whom work in local bars, have been spoken to by police at police headquarters in nearby coastal province Sihanoukville.

Provincial deputy police chief Nop Panha said: "They are being questioned. We are not drawing any conclusions yet."

(Image: Facebook)

Authorities have been checking with fisherman whether the young woman had been caught in their nets.

Dad Phil Bambridge yesterday expressed fears his daughter had been abducted.

"I don't think she's had an accident," he said.

"If she'd just had an accident, she'd have been found by now."

Mr Bamford also reviewed CCTV footage of his daughter leaving her hotel at 2am to go to the beach party in order to clear up what had been conflicting timings provided by the authorities.

"We were getting conflicting times of when she got there," he told Sky News.

"I don't think she's in the sea, I think she's inland somewhere.

"I think someone's taken her. I don't think she's had an accident, if she'd had an accident she would have been found."

He also admitted that hopes he had of seeing his daughter again were fading.

"I'm not doing very well,' he told The Guardian.

"I just hope we can find her, but it seems like it's going to be difficult."

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

As the effort to find her continued yesterday around 150 people were split into two groups, with one searching the ocean and the other the jungle.

Amelia set off on her trip on September 27, when she flew to Vietnam, her family said.

They were alerted to her disappearance after she failed to check out of the Nest Beach Club hostel.

Her passport remained at the hostel.

Staff at Police Beach, a private venue that stages regular events, found Ms Bambridge's purple rucksack, containing her purse, phone and bank cards, the morning after she went missing.

Georgie Bambridge spoke to her sister on the phone in the hours before she was last seen.

(Image: ViralPress)

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

"She went to the Police Beach party on Wednesday night - the last time I spoke to her was Wednesday daytime," she told Sky News .

"She said it was doing so much for her confidence and she found so many people who were friendly.

"She said 'Everyone is so cool here' and couldn't be happier."

She went on to say that her "role model" sister "would never drink to excess" and was "always in control", adding: "She would always be looking out for me, it's not like her to not look after herself.

"I just don't know what's happened."
description: Backpacker Amelia Bambridge, 21, was last seen at a beach party on the Cambodian island of Koh Rong - and six people have now been quizzed by police
